headline.main: We Were Just Laughing: Days With Anja Niedringhaus and Kathy Gannon

docs.snippet: A reporter who was recently with Anja Niedringhaus and Kathy Gannon of The Associated Press, longtime fellow chroniclers of events in Afghanistan, reflects on the attack on them and the changing environment in the country....
docs.abstract: A reporter who was recently with Anja Niedringhaus and Kathy Gannon of The Associated Press, longtime fellow chroniclers of events in Afghanistan, reflects on the attack on them and the changing environment in the country.

headline.print_headline: Scott, Hawks Hurt Cavaliers' Playoff Push, 117-98
headline.main: Scott, Hawks Hurt Cavaliers' Playoff Push, 117-98

docs.snippet: Mike Scott ended a scoring slump with 26 points and the Atlanta Hawks beat Cleveland 117-98 on Friday night in a costly setback for the Cavaliers' late-season playoff push....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Scott ended a scoring slump with 26 points and the Atlanta Hawks beat Cleveland 117-98 on Friday night in a costly setback for the Cavaliers' late-season playoff push.

headline.print_headline: Nets Use 3-Point Attack to Beat Pistons 116-104
headline.main: Nets Use 3-Point Attack to Beat Pistons 116-104

docs.snippet: Shaun Livingston scored 23 points, Mirza Teletovic made six 3-pointers and added 20, and the Brooklyn Nets beat the Detroit Pistons 116-104 on Friday night to extend their home winning streak to 15 games....
docs.lead_paragraph: Shaun Livingston scored 23 points, Mirza Teletovic made six 3-pointers and added 20, and the Brooklyn Nets beat the Detroit Pistons 116-104 on Friday night to extend their home winning streak to 15 games.

headline.print_headline: HP Executives Held in Pakistan Tax Probe: WSJ
headline.main: HP Executives Held in Pakistan Tax Probe: WSJ

docs.snippet: Two executives of the Pakistani arm of computer giant Hewlett-Packard Co were arrested by local officials in Karachi on Friday on suspicion of corporate tax evasion, the Wall Street Journal reported....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two executives of the Pakistani arm of computer giant Hewlett-Packard Co were arrested by local officials in Karachi on Friday on suspicion of corporate tax evasion, the Wall Street Journal reported.
